comments:
Created a TPTP Manual Test with testcases
Attempted to Run my new testsuite as local_deployment

Received Operation in progress popup
Expanded Details. Launching (60%) in footer.
Popup closes abruptly without completing.   No message is displayed to the user.

log file contains the following: 
 
!ENTRY org.eclipse.hyades.test.core 1 0 2006-07-27 13:59:47.765
!MESSAGE org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.local.control.InactiveProcessException
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.local.control.InactiveProcessException
	at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.TestExecutionHarnessExecutorStub.launch(TestExecutionHarnessExecutorStub.java:420)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.TestExecutionHarness.launchTestExecution(TestExecutionHarness.java:2085)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.TestExecutionHarness.access$3(TestExecutionHarness.java:1817)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.TestExecutionHarness$2.run(TestExecutionHarness.java:741)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

After speaking with the originator, this defect is found with a consuming product that ships TPTP V4.2.0 GA running the Integrated Agent Controller (IAC) on Windows XP Professional SP2.  However, using TPTP V4.2.0 GA, this defect cannot be reproduced using the Integrated Agent Controller (IAC) or Agent Controller.  

Since the test execution is stalled/stopped at 60% (test suite/dependency deployment to the target machine), I would assume that the problem is with the Integrated/Agent Controller packaged with the consuming problem -or- a write access/disk space issue with the user's %TEMP% directory.

Please try using the Agent Controller.  Re-open the defect with a test case using only TPTP for reproducing the problem.
